Description: Rim and body sherd of Milesian pre-Fikellura pottery cup with flat everted rim and handle roots; light beige slip; edge of rim glazed; band of strokes on top; at edge of bowl, dot and billet band between pairs of lines; to centre, three birds, painted facing out (heads missing; added red on body); exterior: band on edge of rim; band at junction of lip and body; black on top of handle roots; undetermined painted motif on either side of handle.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 86, no. 9, pl. VI, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.876)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 149-50, Nau 118, pl. 25j)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
